page.title: 07Ecology of the Area
page.content: In Birsley Wood, there are Beech trees, Japanese Larch, Sycamore Lawsons Cypress, Poplar, Alder, Norway Spruce, Oak, Birch and Douglas Fir. At the NE corner of the wood is part of a disused railway which ran from Alnwick to Coldstream. It entered the block at the SE corner and crossed the Edlingham Burn by a fine old arched viaduct, then ran NW and near Hillhead Farm, entered a tunnel some 200 metres long, before crossing the Alnwick / Whittingham road. About 100 acres of a large coniferous forest juts into the SW corner of the block, this is part of Thrunton Woods owned by the Forestry Commission. This corner of the wood, boasts a picnic area and is the starting point for a number of specially marked walks.
